title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 197-3.7 - Extension of time to complete courses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 §§ 197-3.7 - Extension of time to complete courses

State Regulations

The Department of State may grant an extension to any
licensee who evidences bona fide hardship precluding completion of the
continuing education requirements prior to the time the renewal application is
to be filed. A licensee seeking such an extension shall submit a written
request, together with the evidence demonstrating such hardship. Within 30 days
of receipt of a request, the Department of State will notify the licensee
whether their request for an extension has been granted or
denied. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19
§§
197-3.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
